docs.title: bgpipe: BGP reverse proxy and firewall
docs.text: bgpipe is an open source tool for processing BGP messages, which works as a proxy between two BGP peers that can inspect, modify, and secure BGP sessions on the fly. It is based on the BGPFix library, is available for many platforms, and distributed under the MIT license.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• transparent, man-in-the-middle proxy between 2 BGP speakers
  • full, bi-directional BGP to JSON and MRT translation
  • filtering BGP sessions through a background process, eg. a Python script
  • archival of BGP sessions to a file or to a background process
  • remote processing over encrypted websockets (HTTPS), eg. in cloud
  • support for many popular BGP RFCs, including Flowspec
  • TCP server and client with TCP-MD5
  • out-of-the-box BGP session filters and limiters

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: For a video introduction, see the RIPE88 bgpipe talk, or read its APNIC blog summary.
